docs.title: Welcome to Anish's Course Notes
docs.text:
This is my home page. I will use it to organize and share my course notes.

  • Reviewer: Aidan Maguire

docs.title: Quick Go Setup with Dev Containers
docs.text:
• Primary author: Anish Toomu

Required Setup

  • VS Code
  • Docker Desktop running
  • Dev Containers extension in VS Code

docs.title: Steps
docs.text:
1. Make project folder: 

    mkdir my-go-project
cd my-go-project
git init

  2. Make dev container config: 

    mkdir .devcontainer

Config File

Put this in .devcontainer/devcontainer.json: 

{
    "name": "Go Dev",
    "image": "mcr.microsoft.com/devcontainers/go:1",
    "customizations": {
        "vscode": {
            "extensions": [
                "golang.go"
            ]
        }
    }
}

  1. Hit F1, type "reopen in container", click it

  2. Set up Go project: 

    go version   
go mod init my-go-project

  3. Make main.go: 

    package main

import "fmt"

func main() {
    fmt.Println("Hello COMP423")
}

Running Options

go run main.go     # run directly
go build main.go   # make exe file (like gcc in COMP211)
./main            # run exe (use .\main.exe on Windows)

Build vs Run

  • go build works like gcc from COMP211 - it creates an executable file
  • go run is different - it compiles and runs in one step without making an exe file
